feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 20 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 20 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Client requires an automated salary calculation system based on 26 working days per month with dynamic adjustments for extra or fewer worked days.
findings.issue_explanation: The current payroll system lacks automated salary calculation that dynamically adjusts based on actual working days, requiring manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically calculate salary based on precise working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking per employee.
findings.gap_statement: Missing automated, attendance-driven salary calculation that supports pro-rata adjustments without manual intervention.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The system allows payroll settings to take precedence over leave policy formula, with the leave policy formula being greyed out to indicate it is not active
findings.limitation_statement: Leave policy formula cannot override payroll daily wage calculator configuration
findings.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules

findings.group_description: System fails to automatically update unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation
findings.issue_explanation: Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amounts
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when salary configurations are updated after leave request submission
findings.gap_statement: Lacks dynamic salary configuration handling for automatically updating pending leave deductions

findings.group_description: System fails to correctly account for leap years in daily wage and end of service (EOS) gratuity calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator does not recognize 2024 as a leap year with 366 days, causing incorrect service period and gratuity calculations
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically adjust calculations for leap years in service period computations
findings.gap_statement: The system requires enhancement to dynamically handle 366-day years in service period calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation produces consistently lower amounts due to decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating pro-rated End of Service amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but produces systematically lower amounts.
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation engine has limited decimal precision when computing pro-rated amounts for employees leaving mid-month.
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations for partial month settlements.

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculation involves complex service duration and daily wage computation with tiered rates and prorated partial years.
findings.issue_explanation: System calculates gratuity using daily wage divided by 30, with different rates for first 5 years (21 days/year) and subsequent years (30 days/year), including prorated calculations for incomplete years.
findings.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically prorate leave accrual for mid-month departures, requiring manual adjustments for incomplete months.
findings.gap_statement: Lacks flexible leave accrual handling for employees departing mid-month, defaulting to monthly accrual policy.

findings.group_description: System's gratuity calculation method does not transparently handle leap year day inclusion and service duration counting.
findings.issue_explanation: Client reported a minor discrepancy in gratuity calculation, specifically around February 29th, 2024 and how departure date is included in total service days.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear documentation about its leap year and service duration calculation logic.
findings.gap_statement: Need for a clear, user-facing explanation of gratuity calculation methodology, including leap years and departure date handling.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling service periods, especially for partial years and leap year adjustments.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates gratuity using different rates for service periods (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after), with nuanced handling of partial years and leap year day counting.
findings.limitation_statement: The calculation methodology is not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
findings.gap_statement: There is a need for more detailed, user-friendly documentation explaining the precise gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculation uses a fixed divisor of 30 days, which cannot be customized or modified by users or configurations.
findings.issue_explanation: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation method of (Basic Salary / 30), preventing alternative calculation methodologies requested by clients.
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation cannot be configured to use alternative divisors or formulas like (Basic Salary × 12 / 365).
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks flexibility in gratuity calculation methods, specifically in daily wage computation for different organizational calculation preferences.

findings.group_description: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration with fixed divisor settings
findings.issue_explanation: User reported discrepancy between expected and actual leave salary calculation, believing daily wage should be divided by 31 calendar days, but system uses policy-configured divisor (30 days)
findings.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculator uses working days configuration which causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The leave encashment settings in the daily wage calculator are configured to use working days, which causes calculation variations across months with different working day counts
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration, causing calculation mismatches.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), leading to inconsistent results.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically align leave salary and salary proration calculation methods without manual configuration.
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

findings.group_description: Confusion about how daily wage proration calculates working days based on work week configuration
findings.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood that the system calculates working days based on the specific work week configuration, where NVK Operations had all 7 days configured as working days
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional weekend assumptions

findings.group_description: Inconsistent salary proration for offboarded employees based on departure date timing
findings.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. It only prorates correctly for past departure dates.
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator cannot handle dynamic proration scenarios where departure date differs from payroll processing date
findings.gap_statement: Lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

findings.group_description: System creates duplicate payroll deductions when modifying unpaid leave transactions
findings.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
findings.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

findings.group_description: System experiences data synchronization issues when calculating daily wage, particularly around public holiday timing and working days calculation
findings.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between HR and Payroll systems, resulting in incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change
findings.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation uses a non-standard divisor (30.42 days) that can produce deduction amounts different from user expectations
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 days, which can result in deduction amounts that exceed the expected monthly salary
findings.limitation_statement: System uses a custom daily wage divisor that does not align with calendar days or user expectations
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

findings.group_description: Incorrect display of daily wage calculation remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days in leap years
findings.issue_explanation: The system displays an incorrect daily rate in the remarks section for unpaid leave deduction in February, showing 925.81 (based on 31 days) instead of 989.66 (based on 29 days). However, the actual deduction calculation remains mathematically correct.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot dynamically adjust remarks to reflect the correct number of calendar days for different months, especially for February in leap years.
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month.

findings.group_description: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
findings.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for leave deduction calculations

findings.group_description: System displays daily wage rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
findings.issue_explanation: The daily rate displayed is recalculated based on the payroll month (May) instead of the month when leave occurred (April), even though the actual deduction amount is calculated correctly
findings.limitation_statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the original leave occurrence month rate
findings.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for lack of automated daily wage calculation involves manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee

troubleshooting.group_description: Users need to configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first, which will override leave policy formula
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings before configuring leave policy

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual process to correct incorrect unpaid leave deduction calculations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually verify leap year calculations by confirming total days worked
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually count 366 days for 2024 when calculating end of service gratuity, instead of relying on system default of 365 days

troubleshooting.group_description: Users should manually verify End of Service calculations due to potential decimal precision issues
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Double-check pro-rated amounts manually and compare with system-generated calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: For mid-month departures with incomplete leave accrual, manual intervention is possible through system settings or EOS section adjustments.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Use conditional accrual policy for daily leave earning instead of monthly
2. Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section
3. Verify leave policy settings allow for mid-month prorating

troubleshooting.group_description: Users can manually verify and potentially override gratuity calculations.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate total service days, including leap year days, and compare with system-generated amount. Users can edit the final gratuity amount if they disagree with the system calculation.

troubleshooting.group_description: Detailed explanation of how gratuity is calculated for different service periods and partial years.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: For service duration calculation: 1) First 5 years calculated at 21 days per year, 2) Subsequent years at 30 days per year, 3) Partial years prorated by dividing days by 366 (for leap years) or 365 (for non-leap years).

troubleshooting.group_description: Users must manually adjust calculations due to fixed daily wage divisor.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually recalculate daily wage using preferred formula outside the platform, then input final gratuity amount.

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving discrepancies in daily wage calculation by checking policy configuration
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy, confirm divisor setting matches expected calculation method

troubleshooting.group_description: Users can resolve daily wage calculation variations by changing leave encashment settings
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: If consistent calculations are desired, use the 'custom days' setting for leave encashments instead of 'working days'

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration calculations requires manual configuration alignment.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually configure both leave salary and salary proration to use the same daily wage divisor (e.g., 30.42 days) to ensure consistent calculations.

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion about daily wage calculation by checking work week settings
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify employee's work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated, especially for configurations with all 7 days marked as working

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual steps to verify and correct salary proration for offboarded employees
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary by dividing monthly salary by 30, then multiplying by days worked (e.g., 21,000/30 * 15 = 10,500 for 15 days worked)

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual intervention required to remove persistent payroll deductions after leave request deletion
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually delete orphaned payroll deductions after removing leave requests, as the system does not automatically sync and remove associated deductions.

troubleshooting.group_description: When daily wage calculation produces incorrect results due to public holiday timing, manual intervention is the only current resolution
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Create a manual deduction to correct the salary deduction amount when automatic calculation fails

troubleshooting.group_description: How to calculate unpaid leave deductions when an employee is absent for a full month
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Calculate daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (custom days), then multiply by number of leave days

troubleshooting.group_description: Verifying daily wage deduction calculations for months with variable days
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Double-check the actual deduction amount, not just the remarks. Confirm calculation uses correct calendar days (29 for February in leap years).

troubleshooting.group_description: Verify global daily rate configuration when investigating unpaid leave deductions
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check the global daily rate configuration which overrides policy-level calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around daily wage rate display across different payroll months
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: System deployed a fix to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount instead of recalculating every time

glossary.definition: A standard of 26 working days per month used as the basis for salary calculation, derived from 365 total days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year.
A system configuration that determines how daily wage is calculated, typically by dividing salary components by number of days
Calculation of salary reduction based on the number of calendar days an employee is absent without pay, using the daily wage rate.
Calculated by dividing total monthly salary by 30.41 to determine daily wage rate
Termination benefit calculated based on employee's service duration, daily wage, and tiered rates for different service periods.
A year with 366 days, occurring every 4 years, which requires special handling in date-based calculations
A proportional salary calculation for an employee who works only part of a standard pay period, typically calculated by dividing total salary by days in the month.
Leave days are earned and granted at the end of each month, not prorated for incomplete months.
Leave days are earned daily instead of being granted at month-end, allowing more flexible accrual tracking.
Total number of days worked, calculated by counting from start date to departure date, including potential leap year considerations.
End of service benefit calculation that uses daily wage, years of service, and a per-year rate (21 days in this example).
The number of days used to divide monthly salary when calculating daily wage, which can be configured in leave policy settings
Process of determining compensation for periods of employee leave, based on daily rate and policy-configured divisor
Cumulative calculation of vacation leave monetary value, which can vary based on monthly working days configuration
Calculation of salary or leave compensation based on a daily rate, typically derived by dividing monthly salary by a specific number of days (e.g., 30 or 30.42).
Partial salary calculation based on actual days worked, typically calculated by dividing monthly salary by total calendar days and multiplying by days worked
A calculation method that divides monthly salary by 30.42 days instead of calendar days, used for prorating salary and leave deductions
The actual number of days in a specific month, which can vary (e.g., 28, 29, 30, or 31 days depending on the month and leap year status).
A system-wide setting that determines how daily wage deductions are calculated, which takes precedence over individual policy configurations
